The confusion deepens. I've changed the activation function to BipolarsSi=
gmoid and guess what: Same input results in the same output now.
I really d=
on't understand it, but it's great to have a visualizer now :)

Cheers,
Dan=
iel


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Daniel" <daniel_kuppitz@...> wrote:
>
>=
 Hi Colin,
> 
> I've tried several activation functions, Sine was the one t=
hat produced the best results (for a single set of input data). It is defin=
ed in the params.txt with that line:
> 
> SubstrateActivationFunction Sine
=
> 
> If there's no hard coded usage of any sigmoid activation function, the=
n the constructor should be correct.
> 
> However, it doesn't work. The inp=
ut is exactly the same, the output completely different.
> 
> Cheers,
> Dan=
iel

was just

rate

the underlying CPPN/genome. Apart from that method 3 looks about
